column22: To the Shareholder of Pbtel ApS
column26: The Annual Report has been presented in accordance with the Danish Financial Statements Act.
column27: In my opinion, the Financial Statements give a true and fair view of the Company's assets, liabilities and financial position at 31 December 2015 and of the Company's operations for the year 1 January - 31 December 2015.
column34: Transactions in foreign currencies are translated at the exchange rate at the date of transaction. Gains and losses arising due to differences between the transaction date rate and the rate at the date of payment are recognised in the income statement as financial income and expenses.
column35: Amortisation, depreciation and impairment losses comprise depreciation, amortisation and impairment losses of property, plant and equipment.
column36: Expenses for raw materials and consumables comprise the raw materials and consumables used to generate revenue for the year.
column37: Staff costs comprise wages and salaries as well as payroll expenses.
column38: Other external expenses comprise expenses for premises, sales as well as office expenses, etc.
column39: Financial income and financial expenses are recognised in the income statement with the amounts related to the financial year.  Financial income and financial expenses include interest, financial expenses, realised and unrealised exchange adjustments as well as extra payments and repayment under the onaccount taxation scheme.
column40: Other debts are measured at amortised cost.
column41: Receivables are measured at amortised cost, which substantially corresponds to nominal value. Provisions for estimated bad debts are made.
column42: Revenuefrom work performed is recognised in the income statement, provided that delivery and transfer of risk to the buyer have taken place before the end of the year. Revenue is recognised exclusive of VAT and net of discounts relating to sales.
column43: Tax for the year comprises current tax for the year and changes in deferred tax. The tax expense relating to profit/loss for the year is recognised in the income statement, and the tax expense relating to amounts directly recognised in equity is recognised directly in equity.
column44: As security for the guarantee of TDKK 159, made to Kemp & Lauritzen A/S the Company has deposited cash with the booked value TDKK 159.
column51: The Executive Board has today considered and approved the Annual Report of Pbtel ApS for the financial year 1 January - 31 December 2015.
column52: We have audited the Financial Statements of Pbtel ApS for the financial year 1 January - 31 December 2015, which comprise summary of significant accounting policies, income statement, balance sheet and notes, for the Company. The Financial Statements are prepared in accordance with the Danish Financial Statements Act.
column58: In our opinion, the financial statements gives a true and fair view of the CompanyÂ´s financial position at 31 December 2015 and of the results of the Company's operations for the financial year 1 January - 31 December 2015 in accordance with the Danish Financial Statements Act.
column63: We recommend that the Annual Report be adopted by the Annual General Meeting of shareholders.
column68: The Management is responsible for the preparation of Financial Statements that give a true and fair view in accordance with the Danish Financial Statements Act and for such internal control as the Management determines is necessary to enable the preparation of financial statements that are free from material misstatement, whether due to fraud or error.
column69: The Annual Report has not been submitted to the Danish Business Authority within the statutory deadline by which the Management can incur liability .

column35: Amortisation, depreciation and impairment losses comprise depreciation, amortisation and impairment losses of property, plant and equipment.
column36: Expenses for raw materials and consumables comprise the raw materials and consumables used to generate revenue for the year.
column37: Staff costs comprise wages and salaries as well as payroll expenses.
column38: Other external expenses comprise expenses for premises, sales as well as office expenses, etc.
column39: Financial income and financial expenses are recognised in the income statement with the amounts related to the financial year.  Financial income and financial expenses include interest, financial expenses, realised and unrealised exchange adjustments as well as extra payments and repayment under the onaccount taxation scheme.
column40: Other debts are measured at amortised cost.
column41: Receivables are measured at amortised cost, which substantially corresponds to nominal value. Provisions for estimated bad debts are made.
column42: Revenuefrom work performed is recognised in the income statement, provided that delivery and transfer of risk to the buyer have taken place before the end of the year. Revenue is recognised exclusive of VAT and net of discounts relating to sales.
column43: Tax for the year comprises current tax for the year and changes in deferred tax. The tax expense relating to profit/loss for the year is recognised in the income statement, and the tax expense relating to amounts directly recognised in equity is recognised directly in equity.
column44: As security for the guarantee of TDKK 159, made to Kemp & Lauritzen A/S the Company has deposited cash with the booked value TDKK 159.
